		Question: who was ptolemy and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: Ptolemy was a Greek mathematician, astronomer, geographer, and astrologer who lived in the Roman province of Egypt. He is best known for his work on astronomy, in particular for his geocentric model of the universe, which was the dominant cosmological model for over 1,400 years. Ptolemy also wrote extensively on geography, and his work on this subject was also highly influential.
